verses.verse: (A Maskil of Asaph.) O God, <S%H430><s%> why <S%H4100><s%> hast Thou rejected <S%H2186><s%> [us] forever <S%H5331><s%>? Why does Thine anger <S%H639><s%> smoke <S%H6225><s%> against the sheep <S%H6629><s%> of Thy pasture <S%H4830><s%>?

Remember <S%H2142><s%> Thy congregation, <S%H5712><s%> which Thou hast purchased <S%H7069><s%> of old, <S%H6924><s%> Which Thou hast redeemed <S%H1350><s%> to be the tribe <S%H7626><s%> of Thine inheritance; <S%H5159><s%> [And] this <S%H2088><s%> Mount <S%H2022><s%> Zion, <S%H6726><s%> where <S%H2088><s%> Thou hast dwelt. <S%H7931><s%>

Turn <S%H7311><s%> Thy footsteps <S%H6471><s%> toward the perpetual <S%H5331><s%> ruins; <S%H4876><s%> The enemy <S%H340><s%> has damaged <S%H7489><s%> everything <S%H3605><s%> within the sanctuary. <S%H6944><s%>

Thine adversaries <S%H6887><s%> have roared <S%H7580><s%> in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of Thy meeting <S%H4150><s%> place; <S%H4150><s%> They have set <S%H7760><s%> up their own standards <S%H226><s%> for signs. <S%H226><s%>
It seems <S%H3045><s%> as if one had lifted <S%H935><s%> up [His] axe <S%H7134><s%> in a forest <S%H5441><s%> of trees. <S%H6086><s%>
And now <S%H6258><s%> all <S%H3162><s%> its carved <S%H6603><s%> work <S%H6603><s%> They smash <S%H1986><s%> with hatchet <S%H3781><s%> and hammers. <S%H3597><s%>

They have burned <S%H7971><s%> <S%H784><s%> Thy sanctuary <S%H4720><s%> to the ground; <S%H776><s%> They have defiled <S%H2490><s%> the dwelling <S%H4908><s%> place <S%H4908><s%> of Thy name. <S%H8034><s%>

They said <S%H559><s%> in their heart, <S%H3820><s%> "Let us completely <S%H3162><s%> subdue <S%H3238><s%> them." They have burned <S%H8313><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the meeting <S%H4150><s%> places <S%H4150><s%> of God <S%H410><s%> in the land. <S%H776><s%>

We do not see <S%H7200><s%> our signs; <S%H226><s%> There <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> longer <S%H5750><s%> any prophet, <S%H5030><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> is there any among <S%H854><s%> us who knows <S%H3045><s%> how <S%H4100><s%> long. <S%H5704><s%>

How <S%H4970><s%> long, <S%H5704><s%> <S%H4970><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> will the adversary <S%H6862><s%> revile, <S%H2778><s%> [And] the enemy <S%H340><s%> spurn <S%H5006><s%> Thy name <S%H8034><s%> forever <S%H5331><s%>?

Why <S%H4100><s%> dost Thou withdraw <S%H7725><s%> Thy hand, <S%H3027><s%> even Thy right <S%H3225><s%> hand <S%H3225><s%>? From within <S%H7130><s%> Thy bosom, <S%H2436><s%> destroy <S%H3615><s%> [them]!
Yet God <S%H430><s%> is my king <S%H4428><s%> from of old, <S%H6924><s%> Who works <S%H6466><s%> deeds <S%H3444><s%> of deliverance <S%H3444><s%> in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%>

Thou didst divide <S%H9461><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%> by Thy strength; <S%H5797><s%> Thou didst break <S%H7665><s%> the heads <S%H7218><s%> of the sea <S%H8577><s%> monsters <S%H8577><s%> in the waters. <S%H4325><s%>

Thou didst crush <S%H7533><s%> the heads <S%H7218><s%> of Leviathan; <S%H3882><s%> Thou didst give <S%H5414><s%> him as food <S%H3978><s%> for the creatures <S%H5971><s%> of the wilderness. <S%H9478><s%>
Thou didst break <S%H1234><s%> open <S%H1234><s%> springs <S%H4599><s%> and torrents; <S%H5158><s%> Thou didst dry <S%H3001><s%> up ever-flowing streams. <S%H5104><s%>
Thine is the day, <S%H3117><s%> Thine also <S%H637><s%> is the night; <S%H3915><s%> Thou hast prepared <S%H3559><s%> the light <S%H3974><s%> and the sun. <S%H8121><s%>
Thou hast established <S%H5324><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the boundaries <S%H1367><s%> of the earth; <S%H776><s%> Thou hast made <S%H3335><s%> summer <S%H7019><s%> and winter. <S%H2779><s%>

Remember <S%H2142><s%> this, <S%H384><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> that the enemy <S%H340><s%> has reviled; <S%H2778><s%> And a foolish <S%H5036><s%> people <S%H5971><s%> has spurned <S%H5006><s%> Thy name. <S%H8034><s%>

Do not deliver <S%H5414><s%> the soul <S%H5315><s%> of Thy turtledove <S%H8449><s%> to the wild <S%H9130><s%> beast; <S%H9130><s%> Do not forget <S%H7911><s%> the life <S%H9130><s%> of Thine afflicted <S%H6041><s%> forever. <S%H5331><s%>

Consider <S%H5027><s%> the covenant; <S%H1285><s%> For the dark <S%H4285><s%> places <S%H4285><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> are full <S%H4390><s%> of the habitations <S%H4999><s%> of violence. <S%H2555><s%>
Let not the oppressed <S%H1790><s%> return <S%H7725><s%> dishonored; <S%H3637><s%> Let the afflicted <S%H6041><s%> and needy <S%H34><s%> praise <S%H1984><s%> Thy name. <S%H8034><s%>

Do arise, <S%H6965><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> [and] plead <S%H7378><s%> Thine own cause; <S%H7379><s%> Remember <S%H2142><s%> how the foolish <S%H5036><s%> man <S%H5036><s%> reproaches <S%H2781><s%> Thee all <S%H3605><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> long.

Do not forget <S%H7911><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of Thine adversaries, <S%H6887><s%> The uproar <S%H7588><s%> of those who rise <S%H6965><s%> against Thee which ascends <S%H5927><s%> continually. <S%H8548><s%>
